definitions.definition: an official right to be the only person to make, use or sell a product or an invention; a document that proves this

examples.text: to apply for/obtain/take out a patent on an invention
The device was protected by patent.
Edison took out a patent on the light bulb.
In 1843 Bain filed a patent for his fax machine.
In 1995 he was granted a patent for his invention.
The item is Patent Pending No. 11092001.
a leading authority on patent law

wordOrigin: late Middle English: from Old French, from Latin patent- ‘lying open’, from the verb patere. The noun sense is from letters patent.
